titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Israel Parsons, Marcellus, N.Y., physician, was born in 1821. He received an M.D. from the College of Physicians and Surgeons, New York, in 1848, and was a member of the New York State Medical Society, Onondaga County Medical Society, and Syracuse Academy of Medicine. Israel Parsons died on 20 or 24 March 1904.

scopecontent.p: This is a daybook of Israel Parsons. Final volume ("L"), 1894-1904. This volume documents the medical practice of Israel Parsons in Marcellus, N.Y., and surrounding Onondaga County. Listed are patients, services or prescriptions, and amount charged, as well as occasional descriptions of cases.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

acqinfo.p: Provenance: Ebay purchase/gift of Marty Dietrich

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: College of Physicians of Philadelphia: Israel Parsons daybooks and ledger (MSS 2/0298-01).
